title: Harbaugh out as Ravens coach after playoff miss
content: The Ravens fired John Harbaugh, less than 48 hours after losing to the Steelers and failing to reach the playoffs. Sources told ESPN that he's expected to emerge as a favorite for the Giants job but will be in demand for many other teams as well.

title: QB Williams hits portal despite signed UW deal
content: Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. said on social media Tuesday night he is entering the transfer portal, a move that comes just days after he agreed to return to the Huskies for the 2026 season.

title: Chambliss pleads case, hopeful NCAA OKs waiver
content: Trinidad Chambliss acknowledged being a "little frustrated" as he awaits an NCAA decision on a potential waiver for the 2026 season, while his lawyer, Tom Mars, told ESPN that they're working on immediate contingency plans in the event it's denied.

title: Longhorns great Shipley severely burned on ranch
content: Former Texas Longhorns star Jordan Shipley is in critical but stable condition after suffering "severe" burns in an accident on his ranch in Texas on Tuesday, his family said.

title: LSU's Weis with Rebels; has done 'terrific job'
content: Ole Miss offensive assistant Joe Judge praised offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. for how he has been able to juggle his responsibilities with the Rebels and LSU.

title: Declining Devils author 'embarrassing' 9-0 loss
content: The New Jersey Devils, struggling for nearly two months after a scorching 8-1 start, are now searching for answers after a 9-0 loss to the New York Islanders Tuesday, one in which goaltender Jacob Markstrom allowed goals on the first two shots he faced.

title: A's denied 'Athletics' trademark ahead of LV shift
content: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office has denied the A's request to trademark the names "Las Vegas Athletics" and "Vegas Athletics." The club currently plays in Sacramento, but intends to move to Nevada in 2028.

content: The move comes following difficulties expressed by lawyers practising in the district judiciary in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

content: Traders fear the agreement could hit apples stored for the off-season trade hard; there are presently 397.08 lakh metric tonnes of apples in 92 cold storages across Kashmir

content: Himanta Biswa Sarma says, the worsening situation in Bangladesh and evidence of growing jihadist activities in Assam over the last 10 years points to a security threat

title: Sonia Gandhi admitted to Delhi's Ganga Ram Hospital; condition stable
content: According to sources, Ms. Gandhi‚Äôs condition is stable; hospital sources say she is suffering from chronic cough, likely aggravated due to pollution in Delhi

title: VTU to act on private companies demanding money from students instead of providing paid-internships
content: Students have complained that some companies are luring them by promising to provide internship certificates without having to work if they pay

title: Frequent parole to Gurmeet Singh is ‚Äòvery disappointing‚Äô, says son of slain journalist; seeks court intervention
content: The Dera Sacha Sauda chief serving a 20-year jail term for raping two of his disciples, had walked out of Sunaria jail in Rohtak on Monday after he was granted a 40-day parole ‚Äî the 15th time since his conviction in 2017

title: T.N. govt. notifies SOP for large public gatherings
content: The SOP will apply to all public meetings, processions, road shows, demonstrations, protests, cultural and religious events and any other form of public gathering in Tamil Nadu where the anticipated number of participants exceeds 5,000

title: For civic polls, Congress-led Mumbai Vikas Aghadi promises to stop privatisation of hospitals
content: In its manifesto, the Aghadi ‚Äî comprising the Congress, Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi, Rashtriya Samaj Party, and Republican Party of India (Gavai) ‚Äî promises AI-integrated, world-class education, and improved parking services

title: NC leaders oppose separate Statehood for Jammu, push for ‚Äòreunification of Ladakh‚Äô
content: The government would ultimately have to move towards reunification, maintaining that the idea of a divided Jammu and Kashmir is unsustainable, NC Minister Javed Rana says

title: NTR laid strong foundation for Rayalaseema irrigation projects, says Minister Ramanaidu
content: Focused attention by the present coalition government has improved water management, with reservoirs and tanks across the region showing healthy storage levels, asserts the Water Resources Minister

title: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan releases 55 literary works developed by classical language centres
content: The move was a part of our larger national effort to place India‚Äôs linguistic heritage at the centre of education, research and cultural pride, the Minister said.

title: Study Qatar model for Sports City development in Amaravati, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: The CRDA, at its 57th meeting, approves proposals to develop Krishna riverfront as Marina Waterfront and ‚Çπ5,000 monthly pension to orphaned minors in the capital region under the LPS, and ratifies 754 posts across various cadres in the CRDA

title: Piyush Goyal to visit Brussels in ‚Äòdecisive push‚Äô to conclude India-EU FTA talks
content: Mr. Goyal‚Äôs visit comes just weeks before EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and EU Council President Antonio Costa are set to attend India‚Äôs Republic Day as chief guests ahead of the EU-India Summit.

title: Doctors across Telangana to hold black badge protest on January 7 against G.O. 229
content: The government order, issued on December 22, threatens the autonomy and democratic functioning of the Telangana Medical Council, according to doctors

title: Actor Mohanlal to be ‚Äògoodwill ambassador‚Äô of KSRTC
content: KSRTC‚Äôs ticket collection sets a new record, with the corporation netting a total of ‚Çπ12.18 crore as collection from ticket revenue

title: Civic poll surprise: Rare BJP‚ÄìCongress tie-up in Ambernath council; push to edge out Shiv Sena
content: In a surprising political maneuver, BJP and Congress have joined forces in Ambernath to oust the Shiv Sena from its stronghold. Despite Shiv Sena winning the most seats, the BJP-Congress alliance, bolstered by Ajit Pawar's NCP, has formed a majority. This unexpected coalition ahead of larger city elections has drawn sharp criticism from the Shiv Sena.

title: Delhi: MCD's demolition drive near mosque turns violent; 5 cops injured in stone pelting
content: Acting on Delhi High Court orders, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi conducted an early-morning demolition drive near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid. Despite heavy police security and coordination efforts, a brief stone-pelting incident occurred, which was controlled with minimal force. The operation to clear encroached land proceeded with around 17 bulldozers.

title: No security red flag, no venue shift: ICC rejects Bangladesh's T20 World Cup request
content: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's plea to relocate their T20 World Cup matches from India, citing no actionable security threats. Following a BCB request, the global body confirmed no credible danger to the team. While a formal response is pending, the ICC's stance remains firm, with no immediate schedule changes expected.

title: After 10 daughters, Haryana couple welcome a son; father denies patriarchy claims
content: A Haryana woman has given birth to her eleventh child, a son, after ten daughters. The high-risk delivery was successful, with both mother and child recovering well. The father expressed happiness and denied patriarchal attitudes, emphasizing his daughters' capabilities despite societal preferences for male children.

title: AMD CEO on AI-driven hiring: AMD seeks 'AI forward' talent; CEO says productivity is rising
content: AMD CEO Lisa Su stated that AI is reshaping hiring at the chipmaker, prioritizing candidates who are 'AI forward' as the company expands its workforce. She emphasized that AI augments capabilities and increases productivity, rather than leading to job cuts. Su compared the AI revolution's foundational impact on productivity to the Industrial Revolution.

title: Rohit Sharma offered vada pav by a fan; Hitman's reaction goes viral - watch
content: Rohit Sharma politely declined a fan's vada pav offer while intensely preparing for India's ODI series against New Zealand. The star batter, who has had a landmark year with numerous achievements and records, is dedicating significant time to training.

title: Indore: Cong demands Rs 1cr aid for families of deceased; calls Rs 2L relief an ‚Äòinsult to victims‚Äô
content: Congress leaders Jitu Patwari and Umang Singhar visited Indore's Bhagirathpura following a deadly contaminated water crisis. They criticized the state government's response, demanding higher compensation and accountability from officials. The visit was met with heavy police presence, highlighting escalating political tensions over the incident.

title: Bihar: RLM on brink of split as 3 MLAs revolt over ‚Äòparivar politics‚Äô
content: Amidst a brewing political storm, Panchayati Raj Minister Deepak Prakash finds himself in a tight spot as three out of four MLAs from Rashtriya Lok Morcha are reportedly considering a switch to the NDA. Frustration is palpable among the MLAs, who are disturbed by Upendra Kushwaha's choice to appoint his own son, Deepak, as minister without having a legislative seat.

title: Sridhar Vembu explains R&D challenges: Catching up vs innovation; tells key to success
content: Zoho's co-founder Sridhar Vembu highlighted two R&D approaches: catching up and advancing technology, both needing patience and investment. This comes as Zoho shelved its $700 million chipmaking plan due to tech confidence issues. Meanwhile, India is aggressively pursuing semiconductor manufacturing, aiming for global parity by 2032 with significant government backing and industry participation.

title: 134-year-old record shattered: Australia create history in Ashes; achieve rare Test feat
content: Australia achieved a remarkable batting feat at the SCG, registering seven partnerships of 50 or more runs in an Ashes innings, a feat unseen in 134 years. Steve Smith's unbeaten century and Travis Head's 163 propelled Australia to a commanding first-innings lead against England, showcasing exceptional batting consistency.

title: Odisha: Jaundice cases rise to 52 at Khurda JNV; school likely to remain open for classes X & XII
content: Jaundice cases at Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya in Khurda district have surged to 52, prompting the school to consider closing for all but classes X and XII.  Medical teams are conducting tests, and water samples have been collected for contamination analysis.  Efforts are underway to break the disease chain and ensure student safety.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: 'Controlled by me‚Äô: Trump says Venezuela to send US up to 50 million barrels of oil; lays out plan
content: President Trump announced Venezuela's interim authorities will transfer 30-50 million barrels of sanctioned oil to the US. The crude will be sold at market prices, with proceeds controlled by the US government to benefit both nations. This move aims to leverage Venezuela's oil reserves, which have accumulated due to US sanctions.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office: Ranveer, Akshaye starrer surpasses Rs 1,220 crore worldwide
content: 'Dhurandhar' shows resilience at the box office, recovering from a recent dip. The film earned approximately Rs 4.75 crore on its thirty-third day, maintaining a steady graph after a significant drop. Despite slipping into single digits in its fifth week, the movie has amassed a substantial Rs 781.75 crore net in India, with worldwide collections exceeding Rs 1,220 crore.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: MLB trade rumors: Blue Jays eye $500mn Chicago Cubs superstar signing
content: A potential trade between the Toronto Blue Jays and Houston Astros could see Kyle Tucker move to Toronto. This deal would significantly impact both teams, with Toronto acquiring a star outfielder and Houston focusing on cost control and future depth. The trade involves a steep prospect cost for Toronto and potential payroll flexibility for Houston.

title: Travis Kelce at breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 26,150; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 went below 26,150, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Busted! Luxury handbag thieves caught mid-heist in California; heavily armed cops swoop in ‚Äî watch
content: Two individuals were arrested by Irvine Police after a CCTV-captured burglary attempt at a luxury handbag store. The suspects, Richard Bernard Spencer and Marcellus Ronell Shelby, were found with nearly $100,000 worth of stolen goods. They face multiple charges including burglary and grand theft.

title: Jordyn Woods flashes wedding ring in glowing winter look
content: Jordyn Woods shared a winter snapshot that subtly highlighted her engagement ring following her Christmas Day proposal from NBA star Karl-Anthony Towns. Wearing a cozy monochromatic look and sleek braids, Woods kept the focus on understated style and personal meaning. The post follows earlier public appearances where the emerald cut ring drew attention during Knicks games and social media updates.

title: Daisy Shah slams election campaigners after fire breaks out near her flat; shares video
content: A fire erupted in Bandra East, Mumbai, during an election campaign, sparking outrage from actor Daisy Shah. She criticized campaigners for their recklessness, specifically the use of fireworks near residential buildings, highlighting a lack of civic sense and demanding accountability for the incident.

title: Maharashtra: Female student forced to perform namaz at medical college; 2 staffers suspended
content: A female medical student in Palghar was allegedly forced to perform namaz by another student, leading to police action and the suspension of a hostel warden and teacher. The incident, believed to be ragging, triggered campus tension and protests, prompting a police investigation and heavy deployment.

title: UP SIR: Nearly 3 crore names deleted from draft rolls; claims open till Feb 6, final list on Mar 6
content: Uttar Pradesh's draft voter rolls reveal nearly 3 crore deletions, with 18.7% of electors removed. Over 1.3 crore voters were identified as having permanently shifted, while others were untraceable or deceased. Citizens have until February 6 to file claims and objections to reinstate their names before final rolls are published on March 6.

title: Chilly winds, poor air hit Delhiites; dense fog at Palam reduces visibility to 100 metres
content: Delhi experienced cold day conditions Tuesday due to chilly winds and dense fog, with a yellow alert issued for Wednesday. Maximum temperatures dropped significantly in some areas, though not universally meeting the 'cold day' criteria. Air quality also worsened, remaining in the 'very poor' category for the upcoming week.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for Jan 7 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Mehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers, the top stocks to buy today (January 7, 2026) are Varun Beverages Ltd, Havells, and IREDA. Let‚Äôs take a look:

title: AAP sarpanch murder suspect killed in Tarn Taran encounter; pistol seized
content: An accused in the murder of AAP sarpanch Jarmal Singh, Harnur alias Noor, was killed in a police encounter in Tarn Taran. Noor, a key associate of foreign-based gangster Prabh Dasuwal, was involved in reconnaissance and planning for the killing. The encounter occurred when police attempted to apprehend him following intelligence reports.

title: 'Does not belong here': When Manjrekar questioned Kohli's place; how he replied
content: In Januray 2012, after India‚Äôs heavy loss in the second Test in Sydney, Manjrekar suggested giving Virat one more Test just to be sure "he does not belong here". The remark came at a time when Kohli had managed modest scores in his first two Tests of the series and faced growing scrutiny over his spot in the XI.

title: Matt Kalil breaks silence, files lawsuit against ex Haley Kalil over viral claim
content: Former NFL star Matt Kalil is suing his ex-wife, influencer Haley Kalil, for invasion of privacy and unjust enrichment. He alleges she publicly disclosed intimate details about their sex life during a viral online stream, causing him and his new wife significant distress and allowing Haley to profit from the exposure.

title: Mustafizur row: 'He is completely chill' - Ex Bangladesh captain drops big revelation
content: Mohammad Ashraful states Mustafizur Rahman is unfazed by his IPL release due to India-Bangladesh tensions.  The pacer is focused on his BPL commitments, impressing in Rangpur Riders' recent win. Meanwhile, the BCB has formally requested the ICC to move Bangladesh's 2026 T20 World Cup matches out of India citing security concerns.

title: In a first, budget likely to be presented on Sunday
content: The 2026-27 budget is slated for presentation on February 1, a Sunday, marking a rare occurrence. The budget session may commence on January 28 with the President's speech, focusing on shedding colonial mentality and promoting "reform, perform and transform" to shield growth amidst global challenges.

title: Assam: Ahead of poll, Sarma races to woo women voters with Rs 10,000 scheme
content: Assam is on a mission to empower women through self-employment, with the government allocating Rs 10,000 seed capital to over 1.5 million women via the MMUA initiative. This ambitious program aims to cultivate 4 million 'Lakhpati Baideos' in time for the upcoming elections, invigorating rural economies and fostering female entrepreneurship.

title: Rich can‚Äôt bypass tiers of court & come directly to us: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court, led by CJI Surya Kant, asserted that the rich and influential cannot bypass judicial tiers to approach the SC directly. The bench refused to hear a plea challenging a PMLA provision, stating that influential individuals must face trial like ordinary citizens. The court indicated that similar pending pleas challenging the PMLA's validity would be heard together.

title: 'Ikkis' box office collection day 6: Agastya Nanda starrer earns Rs 1.5 cr on its first Tuesday
content: Agastya Nanda's inaugural film 'Ikkis' has hit a rough patch at the box office, reportedly falling short of Rs 25 crore even after a week of release. The war drama, featuring the legendary Dharmendra in his swan song role, only managed to collect Rs THIS amount on day six. Read on.

title: Right to speedy trial irrespective of nature of offence: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has presented conflicting views on bail, asserting that while delay in trial and long incarceration aren't sole grounds for relief, the fundamental right to a speedy trial, irrespective of offense nature, can justify bail. This was highlighted when granting bail to a former chairperson after 16 months, contrasting with a recent rejection for activists.

title: Is Donovan Mitchell playing tonight vs Pacers? Latest Cavs injury update
content: Cleveland Cavaliers' star Donovan Mitchell is resting for Tuesday's game against the Indiana Pacers, a planned absence to manage his heavy workload.  This strategic move prioritizes his long-term health as the team navigates a competitive season.  Both teams face significant injury challenges, shifting the game's focus to depth and execution.

title: Detained for ‚Äòsharing sensitive info with Pak‚Äô: 14-yr-old spy mapped Army posts for ISI
content: Pakistani intelligence has reportedly recruited a 14-year-old boy from Jammu and Kashmir to map military installations, exploiting his psychological struggles and tech-savviness. Manipulated through social media, he was allegedly promised weapons and support by ISI operatives. Authorities are now expanding their investigation and urging parents to monitor children's online activities.

title: Inside Justin Verlander‚Äôs luxury car collection with the Giants
content: San Francisco Giants pitcher Justin Verlander boasts a remarkable collection of high-performance luxury cars, showcasing his passion for speed and style. His garage features eye-catching supercars like the Lamborghini Aventador Roadster and Ferrari 458 Italia, alongside an iconic 1967 Ford Mustang "Eleanor" and a Ford GT, reflecting a diverse taste for both European and American automotive excellence.

title: West Bengal school that received Chavez largesse prays for peace in Venezuela
content: A primary school on Kolkata's outskirts, which received a Rs 12 lakh grant from Venezuela during Hugo Chavez's presidency, held a special prayer for peace in the South American nation. The funds, received in 2007, were used to construct new rooms and improve safety at the Bagu Junior Basic School.

title: BJP allies with Cong to snatch Maha civic body from Sena
content: In a surprising political development, the BJP and Congress have formed an alliance in Ambernath, joining forces with the Ajit Pawar-led NCP to control the municipal council. This coalition, named Ambernath Vikas Aghadi, excludes the Shiv Sena, which emerged as the single-largest party but failed to secure the municipal president's post.

title: Lashkar, Hamas Leaders' Big Meet-Up In Pakistan Amid Deepening Terror Ties
content: Pakistan, which has a long history of sponsoring and sheltering terror outfits on its soil, recently became the venue for a meeting between Hamas and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) commanders.

title: BJP Worker Assaulted, Clothes Torn During Detention In Karnataka
content: A BJP worker has allegedly been assaulted, and her clothes were torn while she was being detained by the police in Karnataka's Hubballi on Wednesday.

title: S Jaishankar On India's Concern Over Venezuela Crisis And An Appeal
content: India is concerned about the recent developments in Venezuela, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said, as the country's deposed president Nicolas Maduro remains in a New York jail after being captured by US forces.

title: Meet Lalu Yadav's Grandson, Who Has Begun Military Training In Singapore
content: 18-year-old Aditya's mother, Rohini Acharya, shared the news on social media, calling him "brave and courageous."

title: Gen Z Protesters In Nepal Are Angry At The Government They Voted For
content: Different demands have emerged from separate groups among the young protesters including direct election of prime ministers, scrapping the present constitution and jailing all previous politicians.

title: Stones Thrown At Cops During Demolition Drive Near Delhi Mosque, 5 Injured
content: The officials carried out a demolition drive at the encroached area near the Syed Faiz Elahi mosque at Turkman Gate following the orders from the Delhi High Court.

title: Venezuela Among 25 New Countries Added To US's Costly Visa Policy
content: President Donald Trump's administration has put 25 more countries on a list of nations whose citizens could be required to post bonds of up to $15,000 to apply for entry into the US, the State Department website showed on Tuesday.

title: Explained: Why Is Somaliland Strategically Important
content: Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, occupies a strategic location at the juncture of the Indian Ocean and Red Sea, with its Berbera port giving access to some of the world's busiest shipping lanes.

title: Gurugram Woman Refuses To Pay For Cab Ride, Threatens With Molestation Case
content: A woman here literally took a cab driver for a ride when she refused to pay the fare after an hours-long drive and threatened him with police action, authorities said on Tuesday.

title: How Delcy Rodriguez Courted Donald Trump And Rose To Power In Venezuela
content: In the days since Maduro's capture, Trump has praised Delcy Rodriguez as a "gracious" American partner while threatening a similar fate as her ex-boss if she doesn't keep the ruling party in check and provide the US with country's vast oil reserves.

title: Five Years Since US Capitol Riot: A Country Still Divided
content: Washington on Tuesday marked five years since a mob overran the US Capitol, with rioters pardoned by Donald Trump retracing their steps even as Democrats revive hearings to hold the president accountable.

title: Colombian Guerrillas Fleeing Venezuela After US Strike: Report
content: Colombian guerrilla commanders who allegedly operated in Venezuela are fleeing following the US military operation in Caracas that ousted leader Nicolas Maduro, a source in the Colombian forces told AFP on Tuesday.

title: US To Get 50 Million Barrels Of Oil From Venezuela At Market Price: Trump
content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday on his social media site that "Interim Authorities" in Venezuela would be selling 30 million to 50 million barrels of "High Quality" oil to the US at its market price.

title: 'He Copied My Dance': Trump On 'Violent Guy' Maduro After Capture
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday accused Nicolas Maduro of imitating his dancing, among other crimes, as he celebrated the capture of the Venezuelan leader in a freewheeling speech to Republican lawmakers.

title: "I'll Get Impeached If...": Trump Warns Republicans Ahead Of 2026 Elections
content: Trump urged his party to more forcefully push back on Democrats' near-unified message on healthcare, as the minority party advocates to extend expired subsidies that made Obamacare insurance more affordable for millions of Americans.

title: Oxford University Apologises Over Content On Shivaji Maharaj In Book Published In 2003
content: Oxford University Press India acknowledged that some statements contained in the book "Shivaji: Hindu King in Islamic India", published in 2003, were unverified.

title: A Political Revolution In US? Ian Bremmer Explains To NDTV What It Means
content: The United States is in the midst of a political revolution, with President Donald Trump attempting to systematically dismantle the checks on his power, capture the machinery of government, and weaponise it against his enemies.

title: "PM Modi Not That Happy With Me As They Are Paying Lot Of Tariffs": Trump
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is "not that happy with me" because of the tariffs imposed by Washington on Delhi for its purchases of Russian oil.

title: Venezuela's New President Hires Ex-Central Bank Boss To Lead Economy
content: Venezuela's caretaker President Delcy Rodriguez appointed a former central bank director to her cabinet's top economic post on Tuesday, a position she herself had held until the toppling of leftist leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: AI Deepfakes, Old Images Fuel Misinformation After Maduro's Capture
content: From AI deepfakes to recycled, outdated images, a surge of visual misinformation has inundated social media platforms after US forces seized Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro in a stunning raid on his Caracas home.

title: Venezuela‚Äôs interim Prez visited Sai Baba ashram multiple times
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. title: What does Pete Carroll's exit mean for the Raiders, Geno Smith?

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: From No. 1 to nowhere: Ranking the biggest disasters of the 2025 season
content: Penn State coach Terry Smith is showered with grass clippings after the win over Clemson . the teams most disappointed with how 2025 played out, loosely ranked in eight categories . four preseason top-ranked teams are most disappointed . a team that has won a title in the past 24 years has lost a season .

title: Tracking live who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Ohio State star WR Tate declares for NFL draft
content: quarterback Carnell Tate is leaving school early and declaring for the draft . he caught 51 passes for 875 yards and nine touchdowns for Ohio State this year . the 6-foot-3, 195 pounds, finished his three-year career with 1,872 yards receiving .

title: Wait, the Ravens moved on from John Harbaugh?! Answering seven questions about the shocking move
content: the Baltimore Ravens are looking for a new head coach after the move . owner Steve Bisciotti said he was searching for the next coach . the manager was fired after guiding the Ravens to a Super Bowl title in 2012 .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the first rankings of 2026 came with plenty of change after the LSU Tigers , Maryland Terrapins and Iowa State Cyclones all lost . ranked no. 5, 6, 7, 8 and 10 from the previous poll all lost in the last four days .
